block.p: Lisa Anne Jacobson and Robert Christian Jones were married last evening by the Rev. Bruce Epperly, a Disciples of Christ minister, at Dumbarton House, a Federal-period house museum in Washington. Rabbi Lewis Solomon took part in the ceremony.

Ms. Jacobson, 31, will keep her name. She is director of international programs for the Business Council for Sustainable Energy, a nonprofit group that encourages more efficient energy use, in Washington. She graduated from the University of Vermont and received a master's degree in international relations from the London School of Economics. She is a daughter of Nancy Jacobson of New York and Jerold Jacobson of Ghent, N.Y. Her father is a senior partner in the New York law firm of Proskauer Rose. Her mother is a visiting nurse for North Shore Home Care in Great Neck, N.Y.

Mr. Jones, 37, is known as Chris. He owns PoliTemps, an employment agency for the public affairs and public relations fields in Washington. He graduated from Texas Tech University and was a Navy intelligence specialist and petty officer second class from 1984 to 1988. His mother, Anna Pecorino of Austin, Tex., is a retired executive assistant at the University of Texas there. His father, Judge George J. Jones of Galveston, Tex., is retired from the Galveston County Probate Court.
